description: Used to connect two contrasting sentences.
example: このレストランは高いですが、おいしいです。
example_translation: This restaurant is expensive, but it's delicious.

description: Indicates sensory perception.
example: いい匂いがします。
example_translation: It smells good.

description: Indicates uncertainty.
example: 彼が来るかどうか知りません。
example_translation: I don't know whether or not he'll come.

description: Conjunction used to give a reason. (Follows a clause).
example: 疲れましたから、休みます。
example_translation: Because I am tired, I will rest.

description: To make something [adjective].
example: 音を小さくしてください。
example_translation: Please make the sound smaller (softer).

description: To become [adjective] or [noun].
example: 背が高くなりました。
example_translation: I became taller.

description: Indicates occasional occurrence.
example: 夜に散歩することがあります。
example_translation: Sometimes I take a walk at night.

description: Formal way to express ability or possibility.
example: 漢字を書くことができます。
example_translation: I can write kanji.

description: Expresses a decision made by the speaker.
example: 毎日走ることにしました。
example_translation: I decided to run every day.

description: Indicates an external decision.
example: 来月日本へ行くことになりました。
example_translation: It has been decided that I will go to Japan next month.

description: Used to list reasons or characteristics.
example: 彼は優しいし、面白いし、好きです。
example_translation: He's kind and funny, so I like him.

description: Indicates excess.
example: 食べすぎました。
example_translation: I ate too much.

description: Expresses appearance or hearsay based on observation.
example: 雨が降りそうです。
example_translation: It looks like it will rain.

description: Expresses someone else's desire.
example: 子供は遊びたがっています。
example_translation: The child wants to play.

description: Indicates limitation.
example: 好きなだけ食べてください。
example_translation: Please eat as much as you like.

description: Strong limitation, with a negative verb ending.
example: 日本語だけしか話せません。
example_translation: I can only speak Japanese.

description: Expresses addition.
example: 日本語だけでなく、英語も話せます。
example_translation: I can speak not only Japanese but also English.

description: Expresses past experience.
example: 日本に行ったことがあります。
example_translation: I have been to Japan before.

translation: in order to; for the purpose of
description: Expresses purpose or reason.
example: 日本語を勉強するために、日本へ行きます。
example_translation: I will go to Japan in order to study Japanese.

description: Conditional used for hypothetical or completed actions.
example: 雨が降ったら、出かけません。
example_translation: If it rains, I won't go out.

description: Used to list examples of actions.
example: 週末は映画を見たり、本を読んだりします。
example_translation: On weekends, I do things like watch movies and read books.

description: Plain form of でしょう, used to express conjecture.
example: 彼は来ないだろう。
example_translation: He probably won't come.

description: Expresses a firm intention or plan.
example: 大学院へ行くつもりです。
example_translation: I intend to go to graduate school.

description: To do something for someone else.
example: 母にプレゼントを買ってあげました。
example_translation: I bought a present for my mom.

description: Indicates a state resulting from an intentional action.
example: 窓が開けてあります。
example_translation: The window has been left open.

description: Indicates continuation into the future.
example: 日本語の勉強を続けていきます。
example_translation: I will continue studying Japanese.

description: Indicates a progressive action or a state of being.
example: 彼は今テレビを見ています。
example_translation: He is watching TV now.

description: To do something beforehand for later convenience.
example: 友達が来るので、掃除しておきます。
example_translation: Since my friend is coming, I'll clean (in advance).

description: Indicates movement toward the speaker or a change that has been happening.
example: 雨が降ってきました。
example_translation: It has started to rain.

description: Someone does something for the speaker (as a favor).
example: 友達が手伝ってくれました。
example_translation: My friend helped me (did me the favor of helping).

translation: do something completely; do by accident
description: Expresses completion of an action or an accidental/unintended action.
example: 本を読んでしまいました。
example_translation: I ended up reading the whole book. / I accidentally read the book.

description: Expresses conjecture or seeks confirmation.
example: 明日は雨が降るでしょう。
example_translation: It will probably rain tomorrow.

description: Used to prohibit an action.
example: ここで写真を撮ってはいけません。
example_translation: You must not take pictures here.

description: To try doing something to see what it's like.
example: 日本料理を食べてみたいです。
example_translation: I want to try eating Japanese food.

description: Indicates concession.
example: 雨が降っても、行きます。
example_translation: I'll go even if it rains.

description: Used to give or ask for permission.
example: 電話を使ってもいいですか。
example_translation: May I use the phone?

description: Expresses allowance or permission.
example: 窓を開けてもかまいません。
example_translation: I don't mind if you open the window.

translation: receive the favor of someone doing
description: To get someone to do something for you.
example: 先生に説明してもらいました。
example_translation: I had the teacher explain it to me (I received the favor of their explanation).

description: Expresses futility.
example: 後悔しても始まりません。
example_translation: It's no use regretting.

description: Expresses relief or happiness about a past action.
example: 傘を持ってきてよかったです。
example_translation: I'm glad I brought an umbrella.

description: Expresses desire for another's action.
example: 手伝ってほしいです。
example_translation: I want you to help me.

description: Conditional used for natural or certain results.
example: 春になると、花が咲きます。
example_translation: When spring comes, flowers bloom.

description: Used to indicate a time when something happens.
example: 子供のとき、ここに住んでいました。
example_translation: When I was a child, I lived here.

description: Expresses the stage of an action.
example: 今から食べるところです。
example_translation: I'm just about to eat.

description: Used to express one's opinion or thoughts.
example: 彼は来ないと思います。
example_translation: I think he won't come.

description: To do two actions simultaneously.
example: 音楽を聞きながら、勉強します。
example_translation: I study while listening to music.

description: Expresses obligation.
example: 勉強しなくてはいけません。
example_translation: I must study.

description: Formal obligation.
example: 明日までに終わらなくてはなりません。
example_translation: It must be finished by tomorrow.

description: Expresses a lack of obligation.
example: 明日は学校に行かなくてもいいです。
example_translation: You don't have to go to school tomorrow.

description: Common obligation.
example: 薬を飲まなければいけません。
example_translation: I have to take medicine.

description: Expresses obligation or necessity.
example: もっと勉強しなければなりません。
example_translation: I have to study more.

description: Expresses a conditional based on the listener's statement.
example: あなたが行くなら、私も一緒に行きます。
example_translation: If you are going, I will go with you too.

description: Attached to a verb stem to indicate that something is hard to do.
example: この靴は歩きにくいです。
example_translation: These shoes are hard to walk in.

description: Used to express a decision or choice.
example: コーヒーにします。
example_translation: I'll have the coffee.

description: Indicates change.
example: 先生になります。
example_translation: I will become a teacher.

description: Conjunction used to give a reason. Softer and more polite than から.
example: 安いので、買いました。
example_translation: Since it was cheap, I bought it.

description: Used to express a contrary-to-expectation result.
example: 雨が降っているのに、出かけます。
example_translation: Even though it's raining, I will go out.

description: Conditional form, often used for general truths or hypothetical situations.
example: 安ければ、買います。
example_translation: If it's cheap, I'll buy it.

description: Indicates correlation.
example: 練習すればするほど、上手になります。
example_translation: The more you practice, the better you get.

description: Indicates that something is the only thing or is done frequently.
example: 甘い物ばかり食べています。
example_translation: I eat nothing but sweets.

description: Expresses a continuing trend, often negative.
example: 物価が上がるばかりです。
example_translation: Prices just keep rising.

description: Indicates an unfortunate cause for a negative result.
example: 病気だったばかりに、試験を受けられませんでした。
example_translation: Simply because I was sick, I couldn't take the exam.

description: Used to give advice.
example: 薬を飲んだほうがいいですよ。
example_translation: You had better take some medicine.

description: Informal way to express resemblance or conjecture.
example: 彼は学生みたいです。
example_translation: He seems like a student.

description: Used to list examples without being exhaustive.
example: 机の上に本やノートなどがあります。
example_translation: There are things like books and notebooks on the desk.

description: Attached to a verb stem to indicate that something is easy to do.
example: このペンは書きやすいです。
example_translation: This pen is easy to write with.

description: Used to express intention or suggestion to do something.
example: 食べよう。/ 食べましょう。
example_translation: Let's eat.

description: Indicates impossibility because of a lack of means.
example: そんなことは知りようがありません。
example_translation: There's no way I could know that.

description: Expresses resemblance/likelihood based on observation.
example: 彼は疲れているようです。
example_translation: He seems tired.

description: Expresses an attempt to do something.
example: 寝ようとしましたが、眠れませんでした。
example_translation: I tried to sleep but couldn't.

description: Expresses one's intention or plan.
example: 来年、日本へ留学しようと思います。
example_translation: I'm thinking of studying abroad in Japan next year.

description: Indicates a conscious effort to do something regularly.
example: 毎日運動するようにしています。
example_translation: I make an effort to exercise every day.

description: Indicates a system or function that is in place.
example: このドアは自動で閉まるようになっています。
example_translation: This door is designed to close automatically.

translation: come to; reach the point where
description: Expresses a change to a new state or ability.
example: 日本語が話せるようになりました。
example_translation: I've reached the point where I can speak Japanese.

translation: it seems; I hear; typical of
description: Used for hearsay or to express something is typical of a certain category.
example: 彼は先生らしいです。
example_translation: He seems like a teacher.

description: Indicates a comparison or a reason for an obligation.
example: 約束した以上、守らなければなりません。
example_translation: Since you promised, you must keep it.

description: Expresses a limit and everything below it.
example: 10歳以下の子供は無料です。
example_translation: Children 10 years old and under are free of charge.

description: Indicates something is excluded from a group or condition.
example: 彼以外は全員来ました。
example_translation: Everyone except for him came.

description: Indicates the start of an action.
example: 彼は走り始めました。
example_translation: He started to run.

description: Indicates the method or way of doing something.
example: 日本語の勉強の仕方が分かりません。
example_translation: I don't know how to study Japanese.

description: Indicates desire for an object.
example: 新しい車が欲しいです。
example_translation: I want a new car.

description: Turns a noun into a na-adjective.
example: 科学的な証明
example_translation: a scientific proof

description: Indicates the completion of an action.
example: 宿題をやり終わりました。
example_translation: I finished doing my homework.

description: Indicates a time frame in which an action occurs.
example: 勉強している間に、雨が降りました。
example_translation: It rained while I was studying.

description: Used to give an example or to say that something is like something else.
example: 彼女は天使のような人です。
example_translation: She is a person like an angel.

description: Used to describe an action that is done in a similar way to something else.
example: 鳥のように飛べたらいいのに。
example_translation: I wish I could fly like a bird.

description: Expresses a possibility.
example: 明日は雨が降るかもしれません。
example_translation: It might rain tomorrow.

translation: only; nothing but (with a negative verb)
description: Emphasizes that there is only a small amount of something or that someone can only do a specific thing.
example: 百円しかありません。
example_translation: I only have 100 yen.

description: Indicates that one action takes place after another.
example: 宿題をしてから、テレビを見ます。
example_translation: I will watch TV after doing my homework.

description: A command form used by superiors to inferiors (e.g., parents to children).
example: 早く寝なさい。
example_translation: Go to bed early.

translation: it is supposed to be; it is expected that
description: Expresses a strong conviction that something is true or will happen.
example: 彼は今日、来るはずです。
example_translation: He is supposed to come today.

translation: it is that; the reason is
description: Used to provide an explanation or ask for one.
example: どうして遅れたんですか。
example_translation: Why is it that you were late?

description: Indicates the sudden start of an action.
example: 赤ちゃんが急に泣き出しました。
example_translation: The baby suddenly started to cry.

description: Indicates that one action takes place before another.
example: 寝る前に、本を読みます。
example_translation: I read a book before sleeping.

description: Indicates that one action takes place after another.
example: ご飯を食べた後で、散歩します。
example_translation: I will take a walk after eating.

description: Indicates the continuation of an action.
example: 彼は走り続けました。
example_translation: He continued to run.

translation: to do (humble form of する)
description: Humble form of 'to do'.
example: 私がご案内いたします。
example_translation: I will guide you.

translation: to be; to come; to go (respectful version)
description: Respectful form of 'to be,' 'to come,' or 'to go'
example: 先生はいらっしゃいますか。
example_translation: Is the teacher here?

translation: (turns a sentence into a yes/no question)
description: A casual, typically male, sentence-ending particle for yes/no questions.
example: 行くかい。
example_translation: Are you going?

description: Used to indicate the raw material something is made from, where the original material is not obvious.
example: 木から紙を作ります。
example_translation: Paper is made from wood.

translation: to show signs of; to appear; to feel
description: Used to describe the apparent feelings or desires of a third person.
example: 彼は犬を怖がっています。
example_translation: He is scared of dogs.

description: Used to indicate that something is necessary.
example: お金が必要です。
example_translation: I need money.

description: Used to express a high degree of certainty.
example: 彼はきっと来ます。
example_translation: He will surely come.

description: Used to make an i-adjective into an adverbial form to modify a verb.
example: 部屋をきれいにくする。
example_translation: To make the room clean.

translation: to exist (the polite form of ある)
description: Polite form of 'to be' or 'to exist.'
example: ここにございます。
example_translation: It is here.

description: Used to turn a verb phrase into a noun.
example: 食べることが好きです。
example_translation: I like eating.

description: A casual way to seek confirmation or express a strong opinion.
example: いいじゃないか。
example_translation: Isn't it good?

description: Used to indicate that something is achieved just by doing a certain action.
example: 英語を勉強するだけで、上達します。
example_translation: You can improve just by studying English.

description: Marks the location where an action takes place.
example: 図書館で勉強します。
example_translation: I study at the library.

description: Marks the means or tool used to do something.
example: 箸で食べます。
example_translation: I eat with chopsticks.

description: Honorific form of 'to be' (です).
example: こちらでございます。
example_translation: This is it.

description: A formal way to seek confirmation or agreement.
example: きれいではないか。
example_translation: Isn't it pretty?

description: Used to suggest something casually or as an example.
example: コーヒーでも飲みましょうか。
example_translation: Shall we drink some coffee or something?

description: Marks a specific point in time.
example: 7時に起きます。
example_translation: I wake up at 7 o'clock.

description: Marks the destination of movement (with verbs like 行く, 来る, 帰る).
example: 日本に行きます。
example_translation: I will go to Japan.

description: Used to express that something is impossible.
example: そんなはずがありません。
example_translation: That can't be true.

translation: it must be; it should be (expectation)
description: Used to express a strong expectation or supposition.
example: 彼は来るはずです。
example_translation: He should come.

description: Expresses that something has not happened yet.
example: まだ昼ご飯を食べていません。
example_translation: I haven't eaten lunch yet.

description: A conditional form for hypothetical situations.
example: もしお金があったら、旅行します。
example_translation: If I had money, I would travel.

translation: in the event of; in the case that
description: Used to indicate a specific case or situation.
example: 病気の場合は、連絡してください。
example_translation: In case of sickness, please contact me.

translation: need to; it is necessary to
description: Used to express necessity.
example: 勉強する必要があります。
example_translation: I need to study.

description: Used to indicate a sudden action or change.
example: 急に雨が降りました。
example_translation: It suddenly started to rain.

description: Used to indicate the period during which an action takes place or a state exists.
example: 彼が寝ている間、テレビを見ていました。
example_translation: I was watching TV while he was sleeping.

description: Used to indicate an approximate time.
example: 3時頃に行きます。
example_translation: I will go around 3 o'clock.
